# from axiestudio.field_typing import Data
from axiestudio.io import Output, DataInput, IntInput, MessageTextInput, DropdownInput, SecretStrInput
from axiestudio.schema import Data
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from langchain_community.vectorstores import Neo4jVector
from langchain_openai import OpenAIEmbeddings
import json
class KnowledgeGraphIndexKRetrieverComponent(Component):
    def __init__(self, **kwargs):
        super().__init__(**kwargs)
        # Populate the node_type dropdown after credentials are set
        if self.neo4j_credentials:
            self.populate_node_type_options()
    
    display_name = "KnowledgeGraphIndexKRetriever"
    description = "Neo4j knowledge graph retriever implemented using vector similarity search. Return top k results."
    icon = "custom_components"
    name = "KnowledgeGraphIndexKRetrieverComponent"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(name="user_query", 
                         display_name="Query",
                         info="User query"),
        IntInput(name="k", display_name="Number of results to return", value=4),
        DropdownInput(
            name="node_type",
            display_name="Nodes to be returned",
            options=[
            ],
            value=""
        ),
        
        DropdownInput(
            name="openai_embedding_model",
            display_name="Embedding Model",
            advanced=False,
            options=[
                "text-embedding-3-small",
                "text-embedding-3-large",
                "text-embedding-ada-002",
            ],
            value="text-embedding-3-small",
        ),
        SecretStrInput(name="openai_api_key", display_name="OpenAI API Key", value="OPENAI_API_KEY"),
        MessageTextInput(name="neo4j_credentials", display_name="Neo4j Credentials")
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Output", name="output", method="build_output"),
    ]

        
    def populate_node_type_options(self):
        # Fetch node types from Neo4j and populate the options
        credentials = json.loads(self.neo4j_credentials)
        driver = GraphDatabase.driver(credentials["url"], auth=(credentials["username"], credentials["password"]))
        
        node_types = set()
        with driver.session() as session:
            result = session.run("MATCH (n) RETURN DISTINCT labels(n) AS labels")
            for record in result:
                node_types.update(record["labels"])

        driver.close()
        
        # Update the dropdown options
        node_type_input = self._get_input_by_name("node_type")
        if node_type_input:
            node_type_input.options = list(node_types)
            if node_types:
                node_type_input.value = list(node_types)[0]  # Set a default value if needed
                
    def build_output(self) -> Data:
        embeddings = OpenAIEmbeddings(
            api_key=self.openai_api_key,
            model=self.openai_embedding_model
        )
        credentials = json.loads(self.neo4j_credentials)
        vector_index = Neo4jVector.from_existing_graph(
            embeddings,
            search_type="hybrid",
            node_label=self.node_type,
            text_node_properties=["text"],
            embedding_node_property="embedding",
            url=credentials["url"],
            username=credentials["username"],
            password=credentials["password"],
        )
        results = vector_index.similarity_search(self.user_query, k=self.k)
        # data = Data(data=results)
        self.status = results
        return results
code.name: code

node.description: Neo4j knowledge graph retriever implemented using vector similarity search. Return top k results.

from axiestudio.base.prompts.api_utils import process_prompt_template
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.inputs.inputs import DefaultPromptField
from axiestudio.io import Output, PromptInput
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message
from axiestudio.template.utils import update_template_values


class PromptComponent(Component):
    display_name: str = "Prompt"
    description: str = "Create a prompt template with dynamic variables."
    icon = "prompts"
    trace_type = "prompt"
    name = "Prompt"

    inputs = [
        PromptInput(name="template", display_name="Template"),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Prompt Message", name="prompt", method="build_prompt"),
    ]

    async def build_prompt(
        self,
    ) -> Message:
        prompt = await Message.from_template_and_variables(**self._attributes)
        self.status = prompt.text
        return prompt

    def _update_template(self, frontend_node: dict):
        prompt_template = frontend_node["template"]["template"]["value"]
        custom_fields = frontend_node["custom_fields"]
        frontend_node_template = frontend_node["template"]
        _ = process_prompt_template(
            template=prompt_template,
            name="template",
            custom_fields=custom_fields,
            frontend_node_template=frontend_node_template,
        )
        return frontend_node

    def post_code_processing(self, new_frontend_node: dict, current_frontend_node: dict):
        """
        This function is called after the code validation is done.
        """
        frontend_node = super().post_code_processing(new_frontend_node, current_frontend_node)
        template = frontend_node["template"]["template"]["value"]
        # Kept it duplicated for backwards compatibility
        _ = process_prompt_template(
            template=template,
            name="template",
            custom_fields=frontend_node["custom_fields"],
            frontend_node_template=frontend_node["template"],
        )
        # Now that template is updated, we need to grab any values that were set in the current_frontend_node
        # and update the frontend_node with those values
        update_template_values(new_template=frontend_node, previous_template=current_frontend_node["template"])
        return frontend_node

    def _get_fallback_input(self, **kwargs):
        return DefaultPromptField(**kwargs)
code.name: code

import operator
from functools import reduce

from axiestudio.field_typing.range_spec import RangeSpec
from langchain_openai import ChatOpenAI
from pydantic.v1 import SecretStr

from axiestudio.base.models.model import LCModelComponent
from axiestudio.base.models.openai_constants import OPENAI_MODEL_NAMES
from axiestudio.field_typing import LanguageModel
from axiestudio.inputs import (
    BoolInput,
    DictInput,
    DropdownInput,
    FloatInput,
    IntInput,
    SecretStrInput,
    StrInput,
)


class OpenAIModelComponent(LCModelComponent):
    display_name = "OpenAI"
    description = "Generates text using OpenAI LLMs."
    icon = "OpenAI"
    name = "OpenAIModel"

    inputs = LCModelComponent._base_inputs + [
        IntInput(
            name="max_tokens",
            display_name="Max Tokens",
            advanced=True,
            info="The maximum number of tokens to generate. Set to 0 for unlimited tokens.",
            range_spec=RangeSpec(min=0, max=128000),
        ),
        DictInput(name="model_kwargs", display_name="Model Kwargs", advanced=True),
        BoolInput(
            name="json_mode",
            display_name="JSON Mode",
            advanced=True,
            info="If True, it will output JSON regardless of passing a schema.",
        ),
        DictInput(
            name="output_schema",
            is_list=True,
            display_name="Schema",
            advanced=True,
            info="The schema for the Output of the model. You must pass the word JSON in the prompt. If left blank, JSON mode will be disabled.",
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="model_name",
            display_name="Model Name",
            advanced=False,
            options=OPENAI_MODEL_NAMES,
            value=OPENAI_MODEL_NAMES[0],
        ),
        StrInput(
            name="openai_api_base",
            display_name="OpenAI API Base",
            advanced=True,
            info="The base URL of the OpenAI API. Defaults to https://api.openai.com/v1. You can change this to use other APIs like JinaChat, LocalAI and Prem.",
        ),
        SecretStrInput(
            name="api_key",
            display_name="OpenAI API Key",
            info="The OpenAI API Key to use for the OpenAI model.",
            advanced=False,
            value="OPENAI_API_KEY",
        ),
        FloatInput(name="temperature", display_name="Temperature", value=0.1),
        IntInput(
            name="seed",
            display_name="Seed",
            info="The seed controls the reproducibility of the job.",
            advanced=True,
            value=1,
        ),
    ]

    def build_model(self) -> LanguageModel:  # type: ignore[type-var]
        # self.output_schema is a list of dictionaries
        # let's convert it to a dictionary
        output_schema_dict: dict[str, str] = reduce(operator.ior, self.output_schema or {}, {})
        openai_api_key = self.api_key
        temperature = self.temperature
        model_name: str = self.model_name
        max_tokens = self.max_tokens
        model_kwargs = self.model_kwargs or {}
        openai_api_base = self.openai_api_base or "https://api.openai.com/v1"
        json_mode = bool(output_schema_dict) or self.json_mode
        seed = self.seed

        if openai_api_key:
            api_key = SecretStr(openai_api_key)
        else:
            api_key = None
        output = ChatOpenAI(
            max_tokens=max_tokens or None,
            model_kwargs=model_kwargs,
            model=model_name,
            base_url=openai_api_base,
            api_key=api_key,
            temperature=temperature if temperature is not None else 0.1,
            seed=seed,
        )
        if json_mode:
            if output_schema_dict:
                output = output.with_structured_output(schema=output_schema_dict, method="json_mode")  # type: ignore
            else:
                output = output.bind(response_format={"type": "json_object"})  # type: ignore

        return output  # type: ignore

    def _get_exception_message(self, e: Exception):
        """
        Get a message from an OpenAI exception.

        Args:
            exception (Exception): The exception to get the message from.

        Returns:
            str: The message from the exception.
        """

        try:
            from openai import BadRequestError
        except ImportError:
            return
        if isinstance(e, BadRequestError):
            message = e.body.get("message")  # type: ignore
            if message:
                return message
        return

# from axiestudio.field_typing import Data
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.io import BoolInput, Output
from axiestudio.schema import Data
q

class IfElseComponent(Component):
    display_name = "If Else Component"
    description = "Capture a boolean value, trigger a workflow based on the input.\n2 outputs will return True or None based on the input.\nUse case: Next component should have a input check header for triggering."
    documentation: str = "http://docs.axiestudio.org/components/custom"
    icon = "custom_components"
    name = "IfElseComponent"

    inputs = [
        BoolInput(name="input_value", display_name="Input Value"),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="True Output", name="true_output", method="build_true_output"),
        Output(display_name="False Output", name="false_output", method="build_false_output")
    ]

    def build_true_output(self) -> Data:
        if self.input_value:
            data = Data(value=True)
            self.status = data
            return data
        else:
            data = Data(value=None)
            self.status = data
            return None
    def build_false_output(self) -> Data:
        if not self.input_value:
            data = Data(value=True)
            self.status = data
            return data
        else:
            data = Data(value=None)
            self.status = data
            return None

# from axiestudio.field_typing import Data
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.io import Output
from axiestudio.schema import Data
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message
import json

class Neo4jCredentialLoader(Component):
    display_name = "Neo4j Credential Loader"
    description = "A handy component to load neo4j credentials"
    icon = "custom_components"
    name = "Neo4jCredentialLoader"

    inputs = [
        StrInput(name="neo4j_url", display_name="Neo4j URL"),
        StrInput(name="neo4j_username", display_name="Neo4j Username"),
        StrInput(name="neo4j_password", display_name="Neo4j Password"),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Credentials", name="credentials", method="build_output")
    ]

    def build_output(self) -> Message:
        message = Message(text=json.dumps(
            {
                'url': self.neo4j_url,
                'username': self.neo4j_username,
                'password': self.neo4j_password
            }
        ))
        self.status=message
        return message

from axiestudio.base.io.chat import ChatComponent
from axiestudio.inputs import BoolInput
from axiestudio.io import DropdownInput, MessageTextInput, Output
from axiestudio.memory import store_message
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message
from axiestudio.utils.constants import MESSAGE_SENDER_NAME_AI, MESSAGE_SENDER_USER, MESSAGE_SENDER_AI


class ChatOutput(ChatComponent):
    display_name = "Chat Output"
    description = "Display a chat message in the Playground."
    icon = "ChatOutput"
    name = "ChatOutput"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(
            name="input_value",
            display_name="Text",
            info="Message to be passed as output.",
        ),
        BoolInput(
            name="should_store_message",
            display_name="Store Messages",
            info="Store the message in the history.",
            value=True,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="sender",
            display_name="Sender Type",
            options=[MESSAGE_SENDER_AI, MESSAGE_SENDER_USER],
            value=MESSAGE_SENDER_AI,
            advanced=True,
            info="Type of sender.",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="sender_name",
            display_name="Sender Name",
            info="Name of the sender.",
            value=MESSAGE_SENDER_NAME_AI,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="session_id",
            display_name="Session ID",
            info="The session ID of the chat. If empty, the current session ID parameter will be used.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="data_template",
            display_name="Data Template",
            value="{text}",
            advanced=True,
            info="Template to convert Data to Text. If left empty, it will be dynamically set to the Data's text key.",
        ),
    ]
    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Message", name="message", method="message_response"),
    ]

    def message_response(self) -> Message:
        message = Message(
            text=self.input_value,
            sender=self.sender,
            sender_name=self.sender_name,
            session_id=self.session_id,
        )
        if (
            self.session_id
            and isinstance(message, Message)
            and isinstance(message.text, str)
            and self.should_store_message
        ):
            store_message(
                message,
                flow_id=self.graph.flow_id,
            )
            self.message.value = message

        self.status = message
        return message
code.name: code

from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.io import MessageTextInput, Output
from axiestudio.schema import Data
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message
import urllib.parse as urlparse

class GraphRAGChatAPIComponent(Component):
    display_name = "GraphRAG Chat API Component"
    description = "Handle API requests"
    documentation: str = "http://docs.axiestudio.org/components/custom"
    icon = "custom_components"
    name = "GraphRAGChatAPIComponent"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(name="api_request", display_name="User's API request", value="/jingconsult.consult/api/?query=What+is+Graph&session_id=session_abc123"),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="User query", name="query", method="build_output_user_query"),
        Output(display_name="User session", name="session_id", method="build_output_user_session")
    ]
    
    def extract_param_from_request(self, param_name: str) -> str:
        # Parse the input URL
        parsed_url = urlparse.urlparse(self.api_request)
        query_params = urlparse.parse_qs(parsed_url.query)
        return query_params.get(param_name, [""])[0]  # Return the first value of the parameter
        

    def build_output_user_query(self) -> Message:
        query = self.extract_param_from_request('query')
        return Message(text=query)

    def build_output_user_session(self) -> Message:
        session_id = self.extract_param_from_request('session_id')
        return Message(text=session_id)

from typing import Optional
from axiestudio.base.langchain_utilities.model import LCToolComponent
from axiestudio.inputs import MessageTextInput, SecretStrInput
from axiestudio.schema import Data
from axiestudio.field_typing import Tool
from langchain.tools import StructuredTool
from pydantic import BaseModel, Field
import psycopg2  # PostgreSQL connect lib
import json
import datetime
class ConversationHistoryRetrieverComponent(LCToolComponent):
    display_name: str = "Conversation History Retriever"
    description: str = "Retrieve a conversation history of a chat session."
    name = "converstaion_history_retriever"
    icon = "custom_components"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(
            name="host",
            display_name="Host",
            info="PostgreSQL server address",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="user",
            display_name="User",
            info="Username for authentication",
        ),
        SecretStrInput(
            name="password",
            display_name="Password",
            info="Password for authentication",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="database",
            display_name="Database",
            info="Database name",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="user_id",
            display_name="Chat User ID",
            info="Chat user",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="session_id",
            display_name="Conversation Session ID",
            info="Chat session",
        ),
    ]

    class PostgreSQLQuerySchema(BaseModel):
        host: str = Field(..., description="PostgreSQL server address")
        user: str = Field(..., description="Username for authentication")
        password: str = Field(..., description="Password for authentication")
        database: str = Field(..., description="Database name")
        query: str = Field(..., description="The SQL query to execute")

    def run_model(self) -> Text:
        # Coletando os inputs
        input_dict = {input_obj.name: input_obj.value for input_obj in self.inputs}

        host = input_dict.get("host")
        user = input_dict.get("user")
        password = input_dict.get("password")
        database = input_dict.get("database")
        session_id = input_dict.get("session_id")
        query = f"""
        SELECT * FROM chat_history
        WHERE session_id = '{session_id}'
        ORDER BY time_stamp ASC;
        """

        # Conectando ao banco de dados PostgreSQL
        try:
            connection = psycopg2.connect(
                host=host,
                user=user,
                password=password,
                database=database
            )
            cursor = connection.cursor()
            cursor.execute(query)
            result = cursor.fetchall()
            cursor.close()
            connection.close()
            
            # Parse row
            results = [
                {
                    'message_id': row[0],
                    'user_id': row[1],
                    'session_id': row[2],
                    'time_stamp': row[3].isoformat(),
                    'content': row[4],
                    'sender': 'user' if row[5] == 0 else 'assistent',
                    'additional_kwargs': row[6]
                }
                for row in result
            ]
            self.status = results
            return results

        except Exception as e:
            if connection:
                connection.close()  # Garantir que a conex?o seja fechada em caso de erro
            self.status = f"Error executing query: {str(e)}"
            return f"Error executing query: {str(e)}"
code.name: code

node.description: Retrieve a conversation history of a chat session.

from axiestudio.custom import Component

from axiestudio.io import DataInput, Output, StrInput
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message
from axiestudio.schema import Data
import json
class ConversationHistoryParserComponent(Component):

    display_name = "Conversation History Parser"
    description = "Merge and convert retrieved conversation history to text."
    icon = "braces"
    name = "ConversationHistoryParser"

    inputs = [
        DataInput(name="data", display_name="Data", info="The conversation history to parse")
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Text", name="Parsed Conversation", method="parse_data"),
    ]

    def parse_data(self) -> Message:
        parsed_output = ""
        for message in self.data:
            timestamp, content, sender = message['time_stamp'], message['content'], message['sender']
            parsed_output += f"[{timestamp}] {sender}: {content}\n"
        self.status = parsed_output
        return Message(text=parsed_output)
code.name: code

node.description: Merge and convert retrieved conversation history to text.

# from axiestudio.field_typing import Data
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.io import MessageTextInput, Output, DropdownInput
from axiestudio.schema import Data

from langchain_openai import ChatOpenAI
from langchain_experimental.graph_transformers import LLMGraphTransformer
from langchain_community.graphs.graph_document import GraphDocument
from langchain_core.documents import Document
import json
class GraphTransformer(Component):
    display_name = "Graph Transformer"
    description = "Transform any text input into graph. Input: text, schema in JSON to control"
    icon = "custom_components"
    name = "GraphTransformer"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(name="input_text", display_name="Input Text", value="Hello, World!"),
        MessageTextInput(name="schema_text", display_name="Schema Text", value="""{
    "allowed_nodes": [],
    "allowed_relationships": [],
    "prompt": null,
    "strict_mode": true,
    "node_properties": true,
    "relationship_properties": true
}"""),
        DropdownInput(
            name="openai_model",
            display_name="Graph Transformation Model",
            advanced=False,
            options=[
                "gpt-4o-mini",
                "gpt-4o",
                "gpt-4-turbo",
                "gpt-3.5-turbo",
            ],
            value="gpt-4o-mini",
        ),
        SecretStrInput(name="openai_api_key", display_name="OpenAI API Key", value="OPENAI_API_KEY"),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Output", name="output", method="build_output"),
    ]
    def process_text(self,text: str, transformer: LLMGraphTransformer) -> List[GraphDocument]:
        doc = Document(page_content=text)
        return transformer.convert_to_graph_documents([doc])
    def build_output(self) -> Data:
        schema = json.loads(self.schema_text)
        llm = ChatOpenAI(
            temperature=0,
            model_name=self.openai_model,
            api_key=self.openai_api_key
        )
        llm_transformer = LLMGraphTransformer(
            llm = llm,
            allowed_nodes=schema.get("allowed_nodes", []),  
            allowed_relationships=schema.get("allowed_relationships", []),  
            prompt=schema.get("prompt", None),  
            strict_mode=schema.get("strict_mode", True),  
            node_properties=schema.get("node_properties", True),  
            relationship_properties=schema.get("relationship_properties", True) 
        )
        result = self.process_text(self.input_text, llm_transformer)
        self.status = result
        return result
code.name: code

node.description: Transform any text input into graph. Input: text, schema in JSON to control

# from axiestudio.field_typing import Data
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.io import MessageTextInput, Output
from axiestudio.schema import Data
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message
from langchain_community.graphs.graph_document import GraphDocument
class GraphSearchCypherComponent(Component):
    display_name = "Graph Search Cypher"
    description = "Generate cypher to search nodes in the graph"
    icon = "custom_components"
    name = "GraphSearchCypher"

    inputs = [
        DataInput(name="data", display_name="User's query graph data"),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Cypher Query", name="output", method="build_output"),
    ]

    def build_output(self) -> Message:
        # only generate queries for nodes search
        output_str = ""
        documents = self.data
        node_ids =[]
        for document in documents:
            for node in document.nodes:
                node_ids.append(node.id)
        query = f"""
        UNWIND {node_ids} as node_id
        MATCH (n {{id: node_id}})
        OPTIONAL MATCH (n)-[]-(doc:Document)
        WITH doc, [key IN keys(doc) WHERE NOT key IN ['elementId', 'id', 'embedding']] AS filteredKeys
        RETURN collect(apoc.map.submap(doc, filteredKeys)) AS docAttributes
        """
        self.status = query
        return query
code.name: code

node.description: Generate cypher to search nodes in the graph

# from axiestudio.field_typing import Data
from axiestudio.io import Output, DataInput, IntInput, MessageTextInput, DropdownInput, SecretStrInput
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from langchain_community.graphs.graph_document import GraphDocument
from neo4j import GraphDatabase

import json
class GraphRetriever(Component):

    
    display_name = "Graph Retriever"
    description = "Execute cypher query to retrieve from knowledge graph"
    icon = "custom_components"
    name = "GraphRetriever"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(name="cypher_query", 
                         display_name="Cypher Query",
                         info="Cypher query"),
        MessageTextInput(name="neo4j_credentials", display_name="Neo4j Credentials")
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Output", name="output", method="build_output"),
    ]

       
                
    def build_output(self) -> Message:
        credentials = json.loads(self.neo4j_credentials)
        driver = GraphDatabase.driver(credentials["url"], auth=(credentials["username"], credentials["password"]))
        
        results = None
        with driver.session() as session:
            results = session.run(self.cypher_query)
            data = json.dumps([doc["docAttributes"] for doc in results.data()])

        driver.close()
        self.status = data  # Update status with extracted data
        return Message(text=data)

from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.io import MessageTextInput, Output
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message


class CombineTextComponent(Component):
    display_name = "Combine Text"
    description = "Concatenate two text sources into a single text chunk using a specified delimiter."
    icon = "merge"
    name = "CombineText"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(
            name="text1",
            display_name="First Text",
            info="The first text input to concatenate.",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="text2",
            display_name="Second Text",
            info="The second text input to concatenate.",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="delimiter",
            display_name="Delimiter",
            info="A string used to separate the two text inputs. Defaults to a whitespace.",
            value=" ",
        ),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Combined Text", name="combined_text", method="combine_texts"),
    ]

    def combine_texts(self) -> Message:
        combined = self.delimiter.join([self.text1, self.text2])
        self.status = combined
        return Message(text=combined)

# from axiestudio.field_typing import Data
from axiestudio.io import Output, DataInput, IntInput, MessageTextInput, DropdownInput, SecretStrInput
from axiestudio.schema import Data
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from langchain_community.vectorstores import Neo4jVector
from langchain_openai import OpenAIEmbeddings
import json
class KnowledgeGraphIndexKRetrieverComponent(Component):
    def __init__(self, **kwargs):
        super().__init__(**kwargs)
        # Populate the node_type dropdown after credentials are set
        if self.neo4j_credentials:
            self.populate_node_type_options()
    
    display_name = "KnowledgeGraphIndexKRetriever"
    description = "Neo4j knowledge graph retriever implemented using vector similarity search. Return top k results."
    icon = "custom_components"
    name = "KnowledgeGraphIndexKRetrieverComponent"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(name="user_query", 
                         display_name="Query",
                         info="User query"),
        IntInput(name="k", display_name="Number of results to return", value=4),
        DropdownInput(
            name="node_type",
            display_name="Nodes to be returned",
            options=[
            ],
            value=""
        ),
        
        DropdownInput(
            name="openai_embedding_model",
            display_name="Embedding Model",
            advanced=False,
            options=[
                "text-embedding-3-small",
                "text-embedding-3-large",
                "text-embedding-ada-002",
            ],
            value="text-embedding-3-small",
        ),
        SecretStrInput(name="openai_api_key", display_name="OpenAI API Key", value="OPENAI_API_KEY"),
        MessageTextInput(name="neo4j_credentials", display_name="Neo4j Credentials")
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Output", name="output", method="build_output"),
    ]

        
    def populate_node_type_options(self):
        # Fetch node types from Neo4j and populate the options
        credentials = json.loads(self.neo4j_credentials)
        driver = GraphDatabase.driver(credentials["url"], auth=(credentials["username"], credentials["password"]))
        
        node_types = set()
        with driver.session() as session:
            result = session.run("MATCH (n) RETURN DISTINCT labels(n) AS labels")
            for record in result:
                node_types.update(record["labels"])

        driver.close()
        
        # Update the dropdown options
        node_type_input = self._get_input_by_name("node_type")
        if node_type_input:
            node_type_input.options = list(node_types)
            if node_types:
                node_type_input.value = list(node_types)[0]  # Set a default value if needed
                
    def build_output(self) -> Data:
        embeddings = OpenAIEmbeddings(
            api_key=self.openai_api_key,
            model=self.openai_embedding_model
        )
        credentials = json.loads(self.neo4j_credentials)
        vector_index = Neo4jVector.from_existing_graph(
            embeddings,
            search_type="hybrid",
            node_label=self.node_type,
            text_node_properties=["text"],
            embedding_node_property="embedding",
            url=credentials["url"],
            username=credentials["username"],
            password=credentials["password"],
        )
        results = vector_index.similarity_search(self.user_query, k=self.k)
        # data = Data(data=results)
        self.status = results
        return results
code.name: code

from axiestudio.base.prompts.api_utils import process_prompt_template
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.inputs.inputs import DefaultPromptField
from axiestudio.io import Output, PromptInput
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message
from axiestudio.template.utils import update_template_values


class PromptComponent(Component):
    display_name: str = "Prompt"
    description: str = "Create a prompt template with dynamic variables."
    icon = "prompts"
    trace_type = "prompt"
    name = "Prompt"

    inputs = [
        PromptInput(name="template", display_name="Template"),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Prompt Message", name="prompt", method="build_prompt"),
    ]

    async def build_prompt(
        self,
    ) -> Message:
        prompt = await Message.from_template_and_variables(**self._attributes)
        self.status = prompt.text
        return prompt

    def _update_template(self, frontend_node: dict):
        prompt_template = frontend_node["template"]["template"]["value"]
        custom_fields = frontend_node["custom_fields"]
        frontend_node_template = frontend_node["template"]
        _ = process_prompt_template(
            template=prompt_template,
            name="template",
            custom_fields=custom_fields,
            frontend_node_template=frontend_node_template,
        )
        return frontend_node

    def post_code_processing(self, new_frontend_node: dict, current_frontend_node: dict):
        """
        This function is called after the code validation is done.
        """
        frontend_node = super().post_code_processing(new_frontend_node, current_frontend_node)
        template = frontend_node["template"]["template"]["value"]
        # Kept it duplicated for backwards compatibility
        _ = process_prompt_template(
            template=template,
            name="template",
            custom_fields=frontend_node["custom_fields"],
            frontend_node_template=frontend_node["template"],
        )
        # Now that template is updated, we need to grab any values that were set in the current_frontend_node
        # and update the frontend_node with those values
        update_template_values(new_template=frontend_node, previous_template=current_frontend_node["template"])
        return frontend_node

    def _get_fallback_input(self, **kwargs):
        return DefaultPromptField(**kwargs)

import operator
from functools import reduce

from axiestudio.field_typing.range_spec import RangeSpec
from langchain_openai import ChatOpenAI
from pydantic.v1 import SecretStr

from axiestudio.base.models.model import LCModelComponent
from axiestudio.base.models.openai_constants import OPENAI_MODEL_NAMES
from axiestudio.field_typing import LanguageModel
from axiestudio.inputs import (
    BoolInput,
    DictInput,
    DropdownInput,
    FloatInput,
    IntInput,
    SecretStrInput,
    StrInput,
)


class OpenAIModelComponent(LCModelComponent):
    display_name = "OpenAI"
    description = "Generates text using OpenAI LLMs."
    icon = "OpenAI"
    name = "OpenAIModel"

    inputs = LCModelComponent._base_inputs + [
        IntInput(
            name="max_tokens",
            display_name="Max Tokens",
            advanced=True,
            info="The maximum number of tokens to generate. Set to 0 for unlimited tokens.",
            range_spec=RangeSpec(min=0, max=128000),
        ),
        DictInput(name="model_kwargs", display_name="Model Kwargs", advanced=True),
        BoolInput(
            name="json_mode",
            display_name="JSON Mode",
            advanced=True,
            info="If True, it will output JSON regardless of passing a schema.",
        ),
        DictInput(
            name="output_schema",
            is_list=True,
            display_name="Schema",
            advanced=True,
            info="The schema for the Output of the model. You must pass the word JSON in the prompt. If left blank, JSON mode will be disabled.",
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="model_name",
            display_name="Model Name",
            advanced=False,
            options=OPENAI_MODEL_NAMES,
            value=OPENAI_MODEL_NAMES[0],
        ),
        StrInput(
            name="openai_api_base",
            display_name="OpenAI API Base",
            advanced=True,
            info="The base URL of the OpenAI API. Defaults to https://api.openai.com/v1. You can change this to use other APIs like JinaChat, LocalAI and Prem.",
        ),
        SecretStrInput(
            name="api_key",
            display_name="OpenAI API Key",
            info="The OpenAI API Key to use for the OpenAI model.",
            advanced=False,
            value="OPENAI_API_KEY",
        ),
        FloatInput(name="temperature", display_name="Temperature", value=0.1),
        IntInput(
            name="seed",
            display_name="Seed",
            info="The seed controls the reproducibility of the job.",
            advanced=True,
            value=1,
        ),
    ]

    def build_model(self) -> LanguageModel:  # type: ignore[type-var]
        # self.output_schema is a list of dictionaries
        # let's convert it to a dictionary
        output_schema_dict: dict[str, str] = reduce(operator.ior, self.output_schema or {}, {})
        openai_api_key = self.api_key
        temperature = self.temperature
        model_name: str = self.model_name
        max_tokens = self.max_tokens
        model_kwargs = self.model_kwargs or {}
        openai_api_base = self.openai_api_base or "https://api.openai.com/v1"
        json_mode = bool(output_schema_dict) or self.json_mode
        seed = self.seed

        if openai_api_key:
            api_key = SecretStr(openai_api_key)
        else:
            api_key = None
        output = ChatOpenAI(
            max_tokens=max_tokens or None,
            model_kwargs=model_kwargs,
            model=model_name,
            base_url=openai_api_base,
            api_key=api_key,
            temperature=temperature if temperature is not None else 0.1,
            seed=seed,
        )
        if json_mode:
            if output_schema_dict:
                output = output.with_structured_output(schema=output_schema_dict, method="json_mode")  # type: ignore
            else:
                output = output.bind(response_format={"type": "json_object"})  # type: ignore

        return output  # type: ignore

    def _get_exception_message(self, e: Exception):
        """
        Get a message from an OpenAI exception.

        Args:
            exception (Exception): The exception to get the message from.

        Returns:
            str: The message from the exception.
        """

        try:
            from openai import BadRequestError
        except ImportError:
            return
        if isinstance(e, BadRequestError):
            message = e.body.get("message")  # type: ignore
            if message:
                return message
        return

# from axiestudio.field_typing import Data
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.io import BoolInput, Output
from axiestudio.schema import Data
q

class IfElseComponent(Component):
    display_name = "If Else Component"
    description = "Capture a boolean value, trigger a workflow based on the input.\n2 outputs will return True or None based on the input.\nUse case: Next component should have a input check header for triggering."
    documentation: str = "http://docs.axiestudio.org/components/custom"
    icon = "custom_components"
    name = "IfElseComponent"

    inputs = [
        BoolInput(name="input_value", display_name="Input Value"),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="True Output", name="true_output", method="build_true_output"),
        Output(display_name="False Output", name="false_output", method="build_false_output")
    ]

    def build_true_output(self) -> Data:
        if self.input_value:
            data = Data(value=True)
            self.status = data
            return data
        else:
            data = Data(value=None)
            self.status = data
            return None
    def build_false_output(self) -> Data:
        if not self.input_value:
            data = Data(value=True)
            self.status = data
            return data
        else:
            data = Data(value=None)
            self.status = data
            return None

from axiestudio.base.io.chat import ChatComponent
from axiestudio.inputs import BoolInput
from axiestudio.io import DropdownInput, MessageTextInput, Output
from axiestudio.memory import store_message
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message
from axiestudio.utils.constants import MESSAGE_SENDER_NAME_AI, MESSAGE_SENDER_USER, MESSAGE_SENDER_AI


class ChatOutput(ChatComponent):
    display_name = "Chat Output"
    description = "Display a chat message in the Playground."
    icon = "ChatOutput"
    name = "ChatOutput"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(
            name="input_value",
            display_name="Text",
            info="Message to be passed as output.",
        ),
        BoolInput(
            name="should_store_message",
            display_name="Store Messages",
            info="Store the message in the history.",
            value=True,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="sender",
            display_name="Sender Type",
            options=[MESSAGE_SENDER_AI, MESSAGE_SENDER_USER],
            value=MESSAGE_SENDER_AI,
            advanced=True,
            info="Type of sender.",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="sender_name",
            display_name="Sender Name",
            info="Name of the sender.",
            value=MESSAGE_SENDER_NAME_AI,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="session_id",
            display_name="Session ID",
            info="The session ID of the chat. If empty, the current session ID parameter will be used.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="data_template",
            display_name="Data Template",
            value="{text}",
            advanced=True,
            info="Template to convert Data to Text. If left empty, it will be dynamically set to the Data's text key.",
        ),
    ]
    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Message", name="message", method="message_response"),
    ]

    def message_response(self) -> Message:
        message = Message(
            text=self.input_value,
            sender=self.sender,
            sender_name=self.sender_name,
            session_id=self.session_id,
        )
        if (
            self.session_id
            and isinstance(message, Message)
            and isinstance(message.text, str)
            and self.should_store_message
        ):
            store_message(
                message,
                flow_id=self.graph.flow_id,
            )
            self.message.value = message

        self.status = message
        return message

from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.io import MessageTextInput, Output
from axiestudio.schema import Data
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message
import urllib.parse as urlparse

class GraphRAGChatAPIComponent(Component):
    display_name = "GraphRAG Chat API Component"
    description = "Handle API requests"
    documentation: str = "http://docs.axiestudio.org/components/custom"
    icon = "custom_components"
    name = "GraphRAGChatAPIComponent"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(name="api_request", display_name="User's API request", value="/jingconsult.consult/api/?query=What+is+Graph&session_id=session_abc123"),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="User query", name="query", method="build_output_user_query"),
        Output(display_name="User session", name="session_id", method="build_output_user_session")
    ]
    
    def extract_param_from_request(self, param_name: str) -> str:
        # Parse the input URL
        parsed_url = urlparse.urlparse(self.api_request)
        query_params = urlparse.parse_qs(parsed_url.query)
        return query_params.get(param_name, [""])[0]  # Return the first value of the parameter
        

    def build_output_user_query(self) -> Message:
        query = self.extract_param_from_request('query')
        return Message(text=query)

    def build_output_user_session(self) -> Message:
        session_id = self.extract_param_from_request('session_id')
        return Message(text=session_id)

from typing import Optional
from axiestudio.base.langchain_utilities.model import LCToolComponent
from axiestudio.inputs import MessageTextInput, SecretStrInput
from axiestudio.schema import Data
from axiestudio.field_typing import Tool
from langchain.tools import StructuredTool
from pydantic import BaseModel, Field
import psycopg2  # PostgreSQL connect lib
import json
import datetime
class ConversationHistoryRetrieverComponent(LCToolComponent):
    display_name: str = "Conversation History Retriever"
    description: str = "Retrieve a conversation history of a chat session."
    name = "converstaion_history_retriever"
    icon = "custom_components"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(
            name="host",
            display_name="Host",
            info="PostgreSQL server address",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="user",
            display_name="User",
            info="Username for authentication",
        ),
        SecretStrInput(
            name="password",
            display_name="Password",
            info="Password for authentication",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="database",
            display_name="Database",
            info="Database name",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="user_id",
            display_name="Chat User ID",
            info="Chat user",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="session_id",
            display_name="Conversation Session ID",
            info="Chat session",
        ),
    ]

    class PostgreSQLQuerySchema(BaseModel):
        host: str = Field(..., description="PostgreSQL server address")
        user: str = Field(..., description="Username for authentication")
        password: str = Field(..., description="Password for authentication")
        database: str = Field(..., description="Database name")
        query: str = Field(..., description="The SQL query to execute")

    def run_model(self) -> Text:
        # Coletando os inputs
        input_dict = {input_obj.name: input_obj.value for input_obj in self.inputs}

        host = input_dict.get("host")
        user = input_dict.get("user")
        password = input_dict.get("password")
        database = input_dict.get("database")
        session_id = input_dict.get("session_id")
        query = f"""
        SELECT * FROM chat_history
        WHERE session_id = '{session_id}'
        ORDER BY time_stamp ASC;
        """

        # Conectando ao banco de dados PostgreSQL
        try:
            connection = psycopg2.connect(
                host=host,
                user=user,
                password=password,
                database=database
            )
            cursor = connection.cursor()
            cursor.execute(query)
            result = cursor.fetchall()
            cursor.close()
            connection.close()
            
            # Parse row
            results = [
                {
                    'message_id': row[0],
                    'user_id': row[1],
                    'session_id': row[2],
                    'time_stamp': row[3].isoformat(),
                    'content': row[4],
                    'sender': 'user' if row[5] == 0 else 'assistent',
                    'additional_kwargs': row[6]
                }
                for row in result
            ]
            self.status = results
            return results

        except Exception as e:
            if connection:
                connection.close()  # Garantir que a conex?o seja fechada em caso de erro
            self.status = f"Error executing query: {str(e)}"
            return f"Error executing query: {str(e)}"

from axiestudio.custom import Component

from axiestudio.io import DataInput, Output, StrInput
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message
from axiestudio.schema import Data
import json
class ConversationHistoryParserComponent(Component):

    display_name = "Conversation History Parser"
    description = "Merge and convert retrieved conversation history to text."
    icon = "braces"
    name = "ConversationHistoryParser"

    inputs = [
        DataInput(name="data", display_name="Data", info="The conversation history to parse")
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Text", name="Parsed Conversation", method="parse_data"),
    ]

    def parse_data(self) -> Message:
        parsed_output = ""
        for message in self.data:
            timestamp, content, sender = message['time_stamp'], message['content'], message['sender']
            parsed_output += f"[{timestamp}] {sender}: {content}\n"
        self.status = parsed_output
        return Message(text=parsed_output)
code.name: code

node.description: Merge and convert retrieved conversation history to text.

code.value:
# from axiestudio.field_typing import Data
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.io import MessageTextInput, Output, DropdownInput
from axiestudio.schema import Data

from langchain_openai import ChatOpenAI
from langchain_experimental.graph_transformers import LLMGraphTransformer
from langchain_community.graphs.graph_document import GraphDocument
from langchain_core.documents import Document
import json
class GraphTransformer(Component):
    display_name = "Graph Transformer"
    description = "Transform any text input into graph. Input: text, schema in JSON to control"
    icon = "custom_components"
    name = "GraphTransformer"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(name="input_text", display_name="Input Text", value="Hello, World!"),
        MessageTextInput(name="schema_text", display_name="Schema Text", value="""{
    "allowed_nodes": [],
    "allowed_relationships": [],
    "prompt": null,
    "strict_mode": true,
    "node_properties": true,
    "relationship_properties": true
}"""),
        DropdownInput(
            name="openai_model",
            display_name="Graph Transformation Model",
            advanced=False,
            options=[
                "gpt-4o-mini",
                "gpt-4o",
                "gpt-4-turbo",
                "gpt-3.5-turbo",
            ],
            value="gpt-4o-mini",
        ),
        SecretStrInput(name="openai_api_key", display_name="OpenAI API Key", value="OPENAI_API_KEY"),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Output", name="output", method="build_output"),
    ]
    def process_text(self,text: str, transformer: LLMGraphTransformer) -> List[GraphDocument]:
        doc = Document(page_content=text)
        return transformer.convert_to_graph_documents([doc])
    def build_output(self) -> Data:
        schema = json.loads(self.schema_text)
        llm = ChatOpenAI(
            temperature=0,
            model_name=self.openai_model,
            api_key=self.openai_api_key
        )
        llm_transformer = LLMGraphTransformer(
            llm = llm,
            allowed_nodes=schema.get("allowed_nodes", []),  
            allowed_relationships=schema.get("allowed_relationships", []),  
            prompt=schema.get("prompt", None),  
            strict_mode=schema.get("strict_mode", True),  
            node_properties=schema.get("node_properties", True),  
            relationship_properties=schema.get("relationship_properties", True) 
        )
        result = self.process_text(self.input_text, llm_transformer)
        self.status = result
        return result
code.name: code

node.description: Transform any text input into graph. Input: text, schema in JSON to control

# from axiestudio.field_typing import Data
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.io import MessageTextInput, Output
from axiestudio.schema import Data
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message
from langchain_community.graphs.graph_document import GraphDocument
class GraphSearchCypherComponent(Component):
    display_name = "Graph Search Cypher"
    description = "Generate cypher to search nodes in the graph"
    icon = "custom_components"
    name = "GraphSearchCypher"

    inputs = [
        DataInput(name="data", display_name="User's query graph data"),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Cypher Query", name="output", method="build_output"),
    ]

    def build_output(self) -> Message:
        # only generate queries for nodes search
        output_str = ""
        documents = self.data
        node_ids =[]
        for document in documents:
            for node in document.nodes:
                node_ids.append(node.id)
        query = f"""
        UNWIND {node_ids} as node_id
        MATCH (n {{id: node_id}})
        OPTIONAL MATCH (n)-[]-(doc:Document)
        WITH doc, [key IN keys(doc) WHERE NOT key IN ['elementId', 'id', 'embedding']] AS filteredKeys
        RETURN collect(apoc.map.submap(doc, filteredKeys)) AS docAttributes
        """
        self.status = query
        return query
code.name: code

node.description: Generate cypher to search nodes in the graph

code.value:
# from axiestudio.field_typing import Data
from axiestudio.io import Output, DataInput, IntInput, MessageTextInput, DropdownInput, SecretStrInput
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from langchain_community.graphs.graph_document import GraphDocument
from neo4j import GraphDatabase

import json
class GraphRetriever(Component):

    
    display_name = "Graph Retriever"
    description = "Execute cypher query to retrieve from knowledge graph"
    icon = "custom_components"
    name = "GraphRetriever"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(name="cypher_query", 
                         display_name="Cypher Query",
                         info="Cypher query"),
        MessageTextInput(name="neo4j_credentials", display_name="Neo4j Credentials")
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Output", name="output", method="build_output"),
    ]

       
                
    def build_output(self) -> Message:
        credentials = json.loads(self.neo4j_credentials)
        driver = GraphDatabase.driver(credentials["url"], auth=(credentials["username"], credentials["password"]))
        
        results = None
        with driver.session() as session:
            results = session.run(self.cypher_query)
            data = json.dumps([doc["docAttributes"] for doc in results.data()])

        driver.close()
        self.status = data  # Update status with extracted data
        return Message(text=data)
code.name: code

node.description: Execute cypher query to retrieve from knowledge graph

code.value:
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.io import MessageTextInput, Output
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message


class CombineTextComponent(Component):
    display_name = "Combine Text"
    description = "Concatenate two text sources into a single text chunk using a specified delimiter."
    icon = "merge"
    name = "CombineText"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(
            name="text1",
            display_name="First Text",
            info="The first text input to concatenate.",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="text2",
            display_name="Second Text",
            info="The second text input to concatenate.",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="delimiter",
            display_name="Delimiter",
            info="A string used to separate the two text inputs. Defaults to a whitespace.",
            value=" ",
        ),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Combined Text", name="combined_text", method="combine_texts"),
    ]

    def combine_texts(self) -> Message:
        combined = self.delimiter.join([self.text1, self.text2])
        self.status = combined
        return Message(text=combined)
code.name: code

delimiter.info: A string used to separate the two text inputs. Defaults to a whitespace.

text1.info: The first text input to concatenate.
